Sebastien Lambla wrote:
> I meant that the plus as an alias to the space character is a specificity of app/www, not of URIs or of the HTTP spec (which defines http URIs).

I think app/www is the only case where this escaping takes place, (well, 
and perhaps in other such formats that use the same technique).

If your code is before such cases then it's only necessary to make sure 
that users can obtain the unescaped query string (because then +, %20 
and %2B can be distinguished, as indeed can = and %3D, ; and %3B and & 
and %26, also necessary for processing app/www query strings).

Convenience functions for escaping to such a commonly use format would 
be, well convenient, and relatively easy to write in many cases.
